content: By 2026, the prompt box will be obsolete, replaced by proactive, agentic AI that observes user behavior and intervenes with actions for review.
The addressable market for AI will expand from $300-400 billion in software spend to $13 trillion in labor spend.

AI agent agency can be categorized into a five-tier model: 1) identifies problem, asks for help; 2) identifies problem, proposes solution, asks for approval; 3) identifies problem, proposes multiple solutions, recommends one; 4) identifies problem, implements solution, keeps you informed; 5) identifies problem, researches diagnosis, evaluates solutions, implements, seeks final approval (S-tier).
Future applications will require minimal prompting as AI observes user behavior and intervenes proactively.

A critical shift is occurring from optimizing for human attention (visual hierarchy) to optimizing for agent parsing (data structure, API access, programmatic navigation), termed 'Machine Legibility'.
Search Engine Optimization (SEO) will evolve into Agent Engine Optimization (AEO) as LLM summaries become top search results and content optimizes for machine understanding.

By 2025, voice agents will achieve breakthroughs in healthcare (patient intake, post-surgery follow-up, psychiatry intake), banking/financial (outperforming humans on compliance), and recruiting (instant interviews for retail to mid-level roles).
Voice agent latency and accuracy have dramatically improved, with some companies deliberately slowing agents to sound more human, and multilingual/accent handling superior to humans.
The transition to AI autonomy will be gradual, not a step function, with ordinary users requiring final approval ~100% of the time and high-liability domains needing extended human oversight.
